title: Vulnerability Cataloging and Exploit Tools
excerpt: A brief overview of systems and tools used globally to catalog, track, and exploit known security weaknesses and vulnerabilities.

full_content.heading: Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE)
full_content.text: A worldwide standard system used to catalog vulnerabilities and security issues. Each entry provides a unique, standardized identifier, making it easier for security teams to track and reference specific flaws. Format Example: `CVE-2024-29988`.

full_content.heading: Exploit Database
full_content.text: A publicly maintained list and archive that catalogs exploit codes from various authors, offering Proof-of-Concept code for known vulnerabilities. It is used by security researchers for testing and by attackers for malicious purposes.

full_content.heading: Security Testing Tools
full_content.intro: Tools and systems used for ethical hacking and security practice:
points: Metasploit: A powerful framework for developing, testing, and executing exploit code.
Burp Suite: A comprehensive platform used for performing security testing of web applications.
AttackBox: Often refers to a pre-configured Linux System (like Kali Linux) accessible from a browser, used for security testing and exploitation practice in controlled environments.
